meanings.sent1: After the storm, the town needed to resupply its grocery stores with fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were relieved when the helicopter arrived to resupply them with ammunition.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful hiker had to resupply his backpack with snacks he left behind.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to resupply his dwindling faith in humanity.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped resupply the dried-up river with much-needed water.

meanings.sent1: The resupply of medical supplies was crucial for the hospital's operations.
meanings.sent2: The resupply of food to the remote village was delayed due to bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The resupply of office stationery brought a wave of excitement to the employees.
meanings.sent4: The resupply of energy drinks kept the athletes going during the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The resupply of books to the library attracted more readers to the community.
